resilience: You cannot be resilient if you spend all of your mental energy on the past, blaming events outside of your control, where fault no longer mattered.
searching for meaning:
"When a man can’t find a deep sense of meaning, they distract themselves with pleasure."

-Viktor Frankl
context switching: Context switching is one of the most expensive actions you can make.
locus of control: There are things in life that are within your control, and the rest that are not.
a tiny change:
'Everyone talks about how if you went back in time, some tiny change could make everything different now, but no one talks about how some tiny change now could make everything different in the future.'

-Paul Graham
sunk costs: If you didn't already do this, would you do it now?
four false idols: Money, Power, Pleasure, Fame. You will never have enough. Blindly striving towards them may eat you alive.
death:
"This is our big mistake to think we look forward toward death. Most of death is already gone. Whatever time has passed is owned by death."

-Seneca
what the hell is water:
"If you’re automatically sure that you know what reality is, and you are operating on your default setting, then you, like me, probably won’t consider possibilities that aren’t annoying and miserable. But if you really learn how to pay attention, then you will know there are other options. It will actually be within your power to experience a crowded, hot, slow, consumer-hell type situation as not only meaningful, but sacred, on fire with the same force that made the stars: love, fellowship, the mystical oneness of all things deep down."

-David Foster Wallace
dealing with regret:
"Though we would like to live without regrets, and sometimes proudly insist that we have none, this is not really possible, if only because we are mortal."

-James Baldwin

Regret makes us human. 
Regret makes us better.
Regret gives us hope.
litany against fear:
"I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain."

-Frank Herbert
hitting rock bottom: Sometimes in life, hitting rock bottom is the greatest incentive to change our lives.
pain and heartbreak:
"You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read. It was Dostoevsky and Dickens who taught me that the things that tormented me most were the very things that connected me with all the people who were alive, or who ever had been alive."

-James Baldwin
standing on giants:
"Employ your time in improving yourself by other men's writings so that you shall come easily by what others have labored hard for"

-Socrates
